column4: someone please help me, I'm really upset...  I just downloaded and burned the Ubuntu 8.04 .ISO...I'm trying to install it inside windows...it goes through the checksums and then starts creating an image, it gets to about 711MB out of 733MB or something, then it stops and says "Cannot access CD, it may be being used by another program."  Which as far as I know, it ain't!  Any ideas?
also, I can't get it to load as a live CD...it get's to about 3% of the kernel, then it says, Cannot access Boot disc
you should burn at the lowest speed
ok, I'll try that
also i think you meant the cd wouldnt boot but you can check it by running as a livecd and click the check cd for errors button
ok, let me try reburning it at a slower speed, then I'll check for errors at reboot
thanks guys
I'll probably be back soon
peace
good luck
thanks
hey again..another question...which write method should I use? Session-At-Once?
write the cd as a RAW/DAO and at the lowest speed as a single session i believe
I have the following options: SAO, TAO, TAO with no pregap, raw96r and raw16
I have the following options: SAO, TAO, TAO with no pregap, raw96r and raw16
i think you need the raw16 most likely not to sure though. what app are you using
InfraRecorder
1 sec
kk
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BurningIsoHowto this should have the correct method. it sounded like you did it fine but this gives you examples to check it for errors
thanks
